    • Constructor Detail

      • ResultsPrinterSimple

        public ResultsPrinterSimple(java.lang.String inputDirectory,
                            java.lang.String printSitewiseSSLS,
                            java.lang.String maxtreesInt)
        Attempts to parse the output of the convergence/congruence pipeline, e.g. *.ser serialized SitewiseSpecificLikelihoodSupportAaml files.
        Parameters:
        inputDirectory - - A string path to a directory. Will be searched non-recursively for *.ser files.
        printSitewiseSSLS - - <0|1> should sitewise dSSLS characters be printed to STDOUT?
        maxtreesInt - - <2...N> Maximum number of trees to look for in the analyses. This will take a minimum value of 2, e.g. the H0 'species' topology and an H1 'alternative' topology. Output is: fitted species trees to output.trees; and tab-delimited results to STOUT and output.txt, one per line for each *.ser file found. In addition, sitewise dSSLS values will be printed out for each results file if printSites=1 is specified.
        See Also:
        ResultsPrinterSimple#extractEnsemblCodeFromSerFile()}, ResultsPrinterSimple#go()}, SitewiseSpecificLikelihoodSupportAaml}

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args -

      • go

        public void go()
        The analysis method called by main():
        • Scans the directory given and looks (non-recursively) for *.ser serialized SitewiseSpecificLikekihoodSupportAaml objects.
        • Attempts to open each one in turn.
        • Prints out the fitted species trees to output.trees
        • Prints out results to screen and output.txt
        The results are printed as tab-delimited ASCII data, one line per file (usually in the input order, e.g. filesystem default alphanumeric sorting - check to verify on your system..!)
      The ordering is:
      • Column Name Values Meaning
      • 0 locus String Name of the locus, if it contains an Ensembl code parseable by ResultsPrinterSimple#extractEnsemblCodeFromSerFile() - usually doesn't
      • 1 ensemblURL String URL for the ensembl gene (see above)
      • 2 shortcode String Shortcode for the ensemble gene (see above)
      • 3 description String Description for the ensemble gene (see above)
      • 4 homog float The observed chi-sq heterogeneity in the input data, via PAML
      • 5 model String The amino-acid substitution model, one of {wag,jones,dayhoff}
      • 6 missingData float or int The value of the missing data filter applied to input alignments to filter gaps. This will be float (if a % of taxa) or int (if absolute number)
      • 7 lnL (species tree) float The log-likelihood of the species (H0) tree, e.g. the first tree fitted. This is obtained from PAML via the aaml.out file and may contain rounding.
      • 8 length (species tree) float Length of the species tree in expected substitutions, again from PAML with rounding etc.
      • 9 model alpha float Alpha parameter of the substitution model
      • 10 numberOfTaxa int Number of taxa in the alignment/tree
      • 11 numberOfSites int Number of sites in the alignment
      • 12 preferredTopology int Which topology is denoted 'preferred' by PAML (refers to input order of trees given in AAML .ctl file / aaml.out, e.g. 0=first, 1=second etc). This uses the SH or KH statistics. See PAML reference for details. Where branch lengths are very short this designation may be meaningless.
      In addition, the following columns are appended for each of the alternative trees H1...Hn (column numberings increment with each additional tree)
      • 13 d_lnL_H1 float The difference in log-likelihoods for the H0 - H1 trees, as reported by PAML's aaml.out file. Note that due to PAML's rounding, this may equal zero even when small sitewise SSLS differences exist.
      • 14 dSSLS_H1 float The average of the sitewise dSSLS values, e.g. sitewise H0 - sitewise H1. This is calculated to BigDecimal precision and ResultsPrinterSimple will attempt to print to 16 decimal place precision; but may be rounded further when printing - do not trust values smaller than about |10e-4| to |10e-6|... NOTE that the denominator for this calculation is the total number of sites, not the number of informative sites, or the number of site patterns.
      • 15 tSSLS_H1 float Average of sitewise dSSLS values as above, except that only 'big threshold' sitewise differences (bigger than |0.1| magnitude in log-units) are counted. NOTE that the denominator for this calculation is the total number of sites, not the count of big-threshold sites, the number of informative sites, or the number of site patterns.
      • 16 numThresh_H1 float The number of individual sitewise dSSLS values for the H0-H1 comparison smaller than -0.1 (e.g. more extreme / very incongruent with H0 / much more supportive of H1)
      • 17 d_lnL_H2 float And so on for each alternative H2, H3.. Hn etc...
      In addition, the individual sitewise dSSLS values are printed out for each .ser file in turn if the printSites=1 option has been invoked.
See Also:
MultiHnCongruenceAnalysis#go()}, ResultsPrinterSimple#extractEnsemblCodeFromSerFile()}
